tha-ap9:0.3_0: The most senior monk deserving of substance
tha-ap9:1.2_0: a leader of the world to the next,
tha-ap9:1.3_0: They’ve attained the level of the Buddha,
tha-ap9:11.2_0: a family born in this life,
tha-ap9:11.4_0: The Teacher will be in the world.
tha-ap9:12.3_0: Having gone forth in the house,
tha-ap9:12.4_0: he will fall under the sway of six years.
tha-ap9:13.1_0: ‘Both the seven months to the rainy season
tha-ap9:13.2_0: of truth when the Buddha is speak.
tha-ap9:14.1_0: who have gone forth out of faith
tha-ap9:14.2_0: I’ve done good things that are good.
tha-ap9:14.4_0: and then I went forth to homelessness.
tha-ap9:15.2_0: the Buddha of the world with its gods,
tha-ap9:16.1_0: He has attained the deathless state,
tha-ap9:17.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
tha-ap9:17.2_0: and skeleton without flesh or blood,
tha-ap9:17.3_0: I have realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
tha-ap9:18.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Kaṇhāṇumataka.
tha-ap9:19.1_0: The seventh section on the senior mendicants have spoken.
tha-ap9:2.1_0: “As far as the range of awakening
tha-ap9:2.2_0: all the spirits have gathered here.
tha-ap9:3.1_0: All the gods in the world
tha-ap9:3.3_0: This one of the Buddha has arrived,
tha-ap9:3.4_0: of darkness, the dark of boundless.
tha-ap9:4.4_0: to the teaching of the Buddha.
tha-ap9:5.1_0: having understood the joy of those gods,
tha-ap9:6.2_0: the Teacher supreme in the world,
tha-ap9:6.3_0: sit down on the limbs of the gods,
tha-ap9:9.2_0: who has made use of gods.
